title: Sizing considerations for GCP deployment
content:
The performance information provided in this section is based on tests in an out-of-box environment and for your reference only. Your implementation may consume more resources or require more resources to perform in an acceptable manner.

Suite size definitions

When you run the suite installer, you will need to select a suite size: Small, Medium, or Large. Different suite sizes require different hardware configurations. 

The following table describes the available suite sizes. 

Suite size Small Medium Large Notes
Maximum number of concurrent users (including both ESS and IT agent users) 100~400 400~1000 1000~3000 Concurrent users are active users who have logged on to the system to perform operations and consume system resources. There are two types of concurrent users, service portal users and IT agent users. The workload for each user type is defined as:
  • For service portal users: After logging in to the system, each portal user has about a 30-minute session duration on the system and will create 1 ~ 2 orders or requests.
  • For IT agent users: IT agent users have longer session duration, and each of them will be active for about 1.5 hours after logon and handle 4 ~ 6 tickets.

Based on the workload assumption above, you can calculate the business operation throughput. For example, for 400 service portal users, the number of newly created orders or requests will be 800 ~ 1600 per hour, while for 400 IT agent users, the number of handled tickets will be 1000 ~ 1600 per hour. If you have a much larger business operation throughput than the numbers provided here, consider adding more worker nodes.

Notes: 

The sizing numbers are based on an assumption that there are only standard Suite tenant users. If you are using one or more Service Manager tenants or using both Suite and Service Manager tenants, user count conversion is needed.

In general, 1 Service Manager user = 0.7 standard Suite users, because a Service Manager tenant consumes only Service Portal in the container when the Suite is integrated with external Service Manager.

For example, if a Suite deployment needs to support 400 Service Manager tenant concurrent users and 100 Service Management tenant concurrent users, the actual user count is 400 X 0.7 + 100 = 380. So you need to select the Small size.
Maximum number of records in Smart Analytics 1 Million 2 Million 2~4 Million

Note:

  • Suite control plane node*: Create a regional cluster if you want to achieve high availability of the GKE control plane.
  • Volume**: 2.5 TB is the minimum allowed capacity for Basic SSD Filestore. See Filestore service tiers for more information.
  • Suite database***:  The suite database Type listed here are indicative. Choose the most suitable machine size from the machine configuration listed on Google cloud platform console. 

** Choose SSD as the database storage for better performance and stability.
** Check Auto storage increase is enabled for cloud SQL PostgreSQL.
** Follow the GCP guidance configure-ha if you want to achieve more high availability on cloud SQL PostgreSQL.


The sizes are for your reference only. They may vary depending on your actual environments such as ticket size, user access rate, and integrations.

Maximum number of CIs and Relationships in CMDB 10 million 60 million 200 million

Tuning configuration

Before installation, you need to tune a PostgreSQL parameter - max_connections.

By default, the maximum concurrent connections of cloud SQL PostgreSQL may not be enough to run the Suite, and customers need to tune the max_connections parameter. For this release, the suggested startup value is 2000. Tune this parameter as instructed in the GCP document How to configure database flags.
